events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of May 1st involving their car hitting a guardrail.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on descriptions referencing vehicle damage and collision details.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to coordinate with the customer and evaluate the auto accident claim.
Customer received acknowledgement of the claim submission with an initial overview of the next steps.
The agent requested police reports, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates to begin claim processing.
Customer submitted required police report, images from the accident, and a preliminary repair quote promptly.
Investigation commenced by reviewing submitted documents and contacting witnesses about the auto accident.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident details matched the claim and no discrepancies were found.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs and rental car reimbursement following the collision.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated prompt communication.
Claim was officially approved based on investigation results and customer acceptance of the settlement offer.
Payment was issued to the customer's preferred account to cover the approved repair and related expenses.
The claim was closed following successful payment and confirmation that the vehicle repairs were underway.
All case files and correspondence for this auto accident claim have been archived in the records system.
